title: MP Warns That UK Faces "An Invasion On Our Culture" By "Medieval" Muslim Men
summary: MP Warns That UK Faces "An Invasion On Our Culture" By "Medieval" Muslim Men Authored by Steve Watson via Modernity.news, Reform UK Member of Parliament Sarah Pochin has urged that Britain is facing a full on invasion from Muslim men who hold ‚Äúmedieval‚Äù views and that it isn‚Äôt...
fullContent: MP Warns That UK Faces "An Invasion On Our Culture" By "Medieval" Muslim Men Authored by Steve Watson via Modernity.news, Reform UK Member of Parliament Sarah Pochin has urged that Britain is facing a full on invasion from Muslim men who hold ‚Äúmedieval‚Äù views and that it isn‚Äôt surprising that British men are forming vigilante groups in preparation. Appearing on Talk TV, Pochin warned ‚Äúit‚Äôs no wonder that we‚Äôre now hearing about groups of concerned British men mobilizing themselves into guardian angel style street patrols.‚Äù ‚ÄúThe inconvenient truth for the left is that the culture of men from predominantly Muslim countries like Afghanistan is one that holds a medieval view of women‚Äôs rights,‚Äù Pochin further asserted. Reform UK MP Sarah Pochin says illegal migrant men coming from Muslim cultures have a "medieval view" of women. "This is an invasion on our culture!"@SarahForRuncorn pic.twitter.com/onEo3Pr3n7 ‚Äî Talk (@TalkTV) August 11, 2025 She added, that ‚ÄúWomen are at risk of sexual assault and rape from these men.‚Äù ‚ÄúHundreds of young men who arrive in this country, housed in our communities, who undoubtedly become sexually frustrated, have a warped view of their right to sexually assault women,‚Äù the MP emphasised. Pochin praised ‚Äústreet patrols out there to protect their daughters, their girlfriends, their wives, even their mothers.‚Äù ‚ÄúAnd why wouldn‚Äôt they be when we hear that these illegal migrants are loitering around schools, around parks, men with deplorable attitudes towards women,‚Äù she further declared. The MP also slammed leftists who appear more concerned with protesting outside parliament every weekend about Palestine, at a cost of millions to the British taxpayer, when there is rampant social breakdown stemming from mass migration at home. Pochin‚Äôs comments come as it is revealed that the UK has seen nearly 50,000 migrants cross the English Channel in small boats since Sir Keir Starmer became Prime Minister on July 5, 2024. üî∫ Number of small boat crossings since Starmer became Prime Minister expected to hit 50,000 on Tuesday. Read the full story ‚¨áÔ∏èhttps://t.co/M0c1zbkbB2 pic.twitter.com/yY1TYJWf3v ‚Äî The Telegraph (@Telegraph) August 12, 2025 This figure, reached in just 401 days, marks a significantly faster rate of crossings compared to Starmer‚Äôs predecessors, with Rishi Sunak taking 603 days and Boris Johnson 1,066 days to hit the same threshold. The numbers of crossings are up by almost 50 percent on last year. 'Just this morning we've had 220 that have arrived in Dover, with three small boats currently out in the Channel with at least 150 people heading towards the UK.' GB News' Mark White reacts to the 'sobering' migrant figures as numbers hit 50,000 so far this year. pic.twitter.com/e5EuRqBFzz ‚Äî GB News (@GBNEWS) August 12, 2025 The surge has fueled criticism of Labour‚Äôs immigration policies, particularly Starmer‚Äôs pledge to ‚Äúsmash the gangs‚Äù behind the crossings, which critics argue has failed to deter the unprecedented influx. Is this before or after the four star hotel stays and loaded debit cards? https://t.co/gkTmck2WD8 ‚Äî m o d e r n i t y (@ModernityNews) August 11, 2025 The Labour government has faced intense scrutiny, with Conservative figures like Kemi Badenoch and Chris Philp accusing it of ‚Äúsurrendering‚Äù UK borders by scrapping the Rwanda deportation plan, which they claim acted as a deterrent. üö®NEWS: More than 50,000 illegal migrants have entered Britain since Keir Starmer took over as prime Minister He's not stopping the boats is he? He lied to everyone didn't he? pic.twitter.com/lq4vUyPBJ7 ‚Äî Basil the Great (@Basil_TGMD) August 12, 2025 Nigel Farage, Reform UK leader, has also slammed Starmer‚Äôs ‚Äúweak‚Äù leadership, predicting the crossings would continue unabated and labelling the situation a ‚Äúnational emergency.‚Äù BREAKING NEWS Illegal migrants can be heard shouting ‚ÄúAllahu Akbar‚Äù as they invade our country. These men will now be free to roam our streets thanks to Keir Starmer. This is a national security emergency. pic.twitter.com/PA60AILbRs ‚Äî Nigel Farage MP (@Nigel_Farage) August 10, 2025 As I predicted 5 years ago, unless we deport illegal migrants the invasion will be huge. 50,000 since our weak Prime Minister took office and there is no sign of it stopping. pic.twitter.com/BUVdb2l7xH ‚Äî Nigel Farage MP (@Nigel_Farage) August 12, 2025 Meanwhile, Labour defends its approach, pointing to a new ‚Äúone in, one out‚Äù deal with France to return some migrants and increased efforts to tackle smuggling gangs. However, public discontent has grown, with protests against asylum seeker accommodations in hotels, and Badenoch suggesting ‚Äúcamps‚Äù as an alternative, citing community safety concerns. üëÄ https://t.co/3arNkknuq9 ‚Äî m o d e r n i t y (@ModernityNews) August 12, 2025 The Home Office insists it is making progress, but the record-breaking numbers‚Äînearly 20,000 in the first half of 2025 alone‚Äîsuggest otherwise. * * * Your support is crucial in helping us defeat mass censorship. Please consider donating via Locals or check out our unique merch. Follow us on X @ModernityNews. Tyler Durden Wed, 08/13/2025 - 05:00

title: These Are The Most Turbulent Flight Routes On Each Continent
summary: These Are The Most Turbulent Flight Routes On Each Continent The visual below, created by Julie Peasley via Visual Capitalist, maps the single most turbulent flight route on each continent using Turbli‚Äôs 2024 rankings.
fullContent: These Are The Most Turbulent Flight Routes On Each Continent The visual below, created by Julie Peasley via Visual Capitalist, maps the single most turbulent flight route on each continent using Turbli‚Äôs 2024 rankings. Turbli compiles daily turbulence along actual flight tracks and reports average intensity using the eddy dissipation rate (EDR) scale from 0 to 100 (light to extreme). South America‚Äôs Mendoza (MDZ)‚ÄìSantiago (SCL) tops the chart at 24.684 average EDR, followed by mountain-hugging routes such as Kathmandu‚ÄìLhasa, Albuquerque‚ÄìDenver, and Christchurch‚ÄìWellington. Interestingly, SCL has the distinction of being the world‚Äôs most turbulent airport. Europe‚Äôs Nice‚ÄìGeneva and Africa‚Äôs Durban‚ÄìJohannesburg also make the list. What the Data Shows Several of the bumpiest routes trace over or alongside major mountain chains‚Äîthe Andes, Himalayas, Alps, and Southern Alps‚Äîwhere strong winds can generate mountain waves, rotors, and turbulent shear. Island-to-island or strait crossings (e.g., Wellington) also see rough air as winds accelerate through gaps. Why Turbulence Is Rising A growing body of research points to more frequent clear-air turbulence (CAT), driven by climate change. Warmer air intensifies wind shear in jet streams; over the North Atlantic, the annual duration of severe CAT increased about 55% between 1979 and 2020, with notable rises across other busy regions as well. EDR: The Standard for ‚ÄúHow Bumpy‚Äù EDR is an objective, aircraft-independent measure of turbulence intensity and the ICAO/WMO standard used in aviation. NCAR and partners compute EDR from onboard parameters to create consistent, comparable reports, which is exactly the kind of metric Turbli aggregates for its rankings. What This Means for Flyers Rougher skies don‚Äôt mean flying is unsafe. Modern aircraft are designed for turbulence, and injuries are rare when seat belts are fastened. For broader context on risk, see our chart on air travel fatalities per million passengers. Explore more aviation data, including Longest Flights of the World, on Voronoi. Tyler Durden Wed, 08/13/2025 - 04:15

title: Which sectors will outperform the market in 2025? Hospitals, airlines, or something else?
summary: Kotak Securities anticipates muted earnings growth, revising FY26 projections downward due to weaker economic commentary. They recommend a cautious investment approach, favoring domestic-focused sectors like hospitals, hotels, airlines, and select NBFCs.
fullContent: Kotak Securities anticipates muted earnings growth, revising FY26 projections downward due to weaker economic commentary. They recommend a cautious investment approach, favoring domestic-focused sectors like hospitals, hotels, airlines, and select NBFCs. While IT and consumer sectors may underperform, attractive valuations in private banks offer relative appeal despite modest earnings growth.
